website_summaries.verdict: The Photosmart 145 is a low-cost option for those in search of a portable, dedicated photo printer, but we recommend the Photosmart 245 if you can afford it.
pros: includes a multitude of direct-print options
cons: must swap out ink cartridges to print in black and white

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED IN HP!
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE! This printer does NOT accept MEMORY FLASH DRIVES. They provide a CD to set up the printer on your computer, but there is no USB cord to connect the printer to the computer! Standard digital camera cords are too small. Printer is not compatible with Windows Vista Home! So that means I cannot install this printer to my computer! I think I will be returning it!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen D Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I could not get my sd card to work but my mirco card works well.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: not the best i have boughten
customer_reviews.text: this is not as good as the one i used to have. the pics do not come out as good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: The printer was good but the ink that came with the printer was so old it would not work. Had to buy a new ink cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: Tamra

customer_reviews.title: Won't work with Windows 10!
customer_reviews.text: This WAS a good printer when it was introduced in 2004. However, HP has discontinued the production AND the support/drivers for this unit. Their last driver was written for Windows XP. There were some workarounds using the PhotoSmart 330 drivers that would work with Windows 7. Windows 10 is a complete bust with the 245. The printer will work fine without a computer just by printing images off an SD memory card (NO USB ports on the printer however).
customer_reviews.author: Jim H.

customer_reviews.title: HP PhotoSmart 245 Compact Photo Printer
customer_reviews.text: Got the printer and within minutes I was printing quality photographs!! I had been looking for a printer like this for some time now. I photograph small items in macro conditions that are used for insurance appraisals and this printer fits the bill. Set-up is fast and easy and printing time (in color - hi-res) is plenty fast for my tastes. The included software for the PC allows you to print out anything from wallet to 4x6" prints with just the click of a button. If you don't want to use a PC, loading pictures directly from you media card or from the camera directly is a breeze. Excellent printer for someone on the go!!
customer_reviews.author: searay74

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good printer ruined by print stickiness problem
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about a year - great looking results, especially if corrected and printed from a good software package. The stickiness problem seems insurmountable. I have tried several different papers and drying times up to 3 weeks, but they will always stick to photo album transparent material (have tried several brands). I wish HP would sought this problem out - also occurs with prints from other HP printer models. Finally bought a Cannon Selphy dye-sub printer which does not have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Traveller

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in NY
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved this printer, it is simple to use and can be used alone or through your pc. Unfortunately the photos never dry. At first I thought it was because I either framed them or put them in an album before they had a chance to dry. I then printed some and let them sit out to dry for weeks and the photos never dried. Any photos that I have framed eventually stick to the glass, particularily the darker spots of the photo. I even got a new printer from HP and still encountered the same problem...has anyone else had this problem? (Yes I am using the correct HP paper and ink)
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: This printer is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this printer to my Brother for Christmas 2 years ago. While I was visiting him last week in Montana, we printed out the pictures I took. they turned out better then regular film. I couldn't believe what I was seeing. I plan to buy myself one.
customer_reviews.author: Gleyn

customer_reviews.title: Most awesome photo printer on the market
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the most convenient, compact, and coolest gadget that HP has come out with. You don't even need your computer or your camera. You just extract the memory card, plug it into the printer and BAM, in seconds you have beautiful pictures. It is truly what I have been waiting for. I have been looking and looking for a portable printer that would accomadate the XD card from my Olympus camera and here it is.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: 100% GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: This printer started giving me the infamous "invisible paper jam" error after about one year...I would give this product negative stars if I could. It is absurdly overpriced. I've been subjected to HP's crap products both at work and at home...and in my opinion, "HP" is just another word for "junk". DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Randallius

customer_reviews.title: False Paper Jam
customer_reviews.text: Bad .... this is the second HP PhotoSmart printer I've owned and I had to return it the store for a new one. When they work ... they work great. But like my first PhotoSmart, this one had to be returned for a replacement due to an inherent design flaw (firmware). The printer works fine for a while. In this case, two days. Then it started giving an erroneous 'print jam' error when in fact there was nothing causing the jam. HP said to return to store for new or refund. I keep wondering when HP is going to fix this problem?
customer_reviews.author: John Heinisch

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Photo printer- BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Photo printer- BEWARE.. No longer compatible with windows. After the end of XP, this printer is not supported by windows drivers. you will have to get a tech to make a 'work around' to get it to install in win 7 and above.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hp PhotoSmart 245 Compact Printer
customer_reviews.text: This little printer Rocks!!! It is easy to use, compact and totally portable. The print quality is awsome...it prints a photo in about 60-90 seconds. It accepts all newer digital camera media. You can preview your photos on a 2" screen. Also, you can print a sheet with 2 photos, 4, 6, 8, 24. Hewlett Packard does it again. The quality, and good price is the best selling point. Many acessories available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So neat, I bought a second one!
customer_reviews.text: Even though it's portable, I wanted a second for my office. Prints pictures every bit as beautiful as my HP Photosmart 1215. I love it! Whatever will they think of next?
customer_reviews.author: Jean Mann

product_meta.title: HP PhotoSmart 245 Compact Photo Printer
feature_bullets: Prints directly from your digital camera's memory card
Up to 4,800 optimized dpi printing for vivid color and crisp detail
USB interface, 4 memory card slots; PC and Mac compatible
